defaultValue: The changes apply only if no save has been loaded yet. Otherwise a restart is required.

fieldName: The Default Ratio of Surplus Value
fieldDescription: Defines the split between worker wages and surplus output. Higher values mean lower wages. Used by NPC markets.

fieldName: The Maximum Ratio of Surplus Value
fieldDescription: The maximum value for player owned colonies.

fieldName: The Monthly Value of Labor Power
fieldDescription: The value in credits produced by a single worker per month.
Used by industries without a specified RoCV entry.
Used by heavy industry and refining.
Used by mining and fuel production.
Used by space related industries.

defaultValue: The changes apply only if no save has been loaded yet. Otherwise a restart is required.

fieldDescription: Runs the economy loop inside a separate thread
The starting credits each colony has. Used for player colonies as well.
Higher values result in a more even spread of workers.
Higher values encourage more demand fulfillment.
The minimum fraction of the fair share of workers for each output to be enforced
Workers are allocated to meet demand by a factor of 1 + x.
Higher values improve allocation stability at the cost of performance.
Workers of NPC markets will be re-allocated every x days.
Days of demand markets aim to stockpile, affecting imports, exports, and base prices.
Limits how many days of demand can be satisfied per import cycle to reduce volatility.
Multiplier for excess stock required before a market begins exporting.
Adjusts prices for goods traded between markets of the same faction. Set to 0 for free in-faction trade.
The relationship hit for imposing an embargo. 1 means 100 relation points.
